abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel is trying to soften his image in lead-up to runoff election; tactic seems to be acknowledgment of fact that his abrasive personality and hardball tactics may have turned enough voters off for him to fail to win more than 50 percent of vote in February; Emanuel has tried to convey to voters that he is cognizant of brash ways he may have dealt with issues in his first term, as in his treatment of unions and decision to close public schools.
lead_paragraph: As a runoff with Jesus G. Garcia approaches next Tuesday, some voters say they have soured on hardball tactics and gruffness.

headline.main: Rahm Emanuel, Chicago’s Rough-Edged Mayor, Tries the Sandpaper
headline.print_headline: Chicago’s Rough-Edged Mayor, in a Runoff, Tries the Sandpaper

snippet: As a runoff with Jesus G. Garcia approaches next Tuesday, some voters say they have soured on hardball tactics and gruffness.
